question:
Rwanda’s efforts against cervical cancer has been highlighted in news recently. In this context, consider the following statements about this cancer:
  1. It is caused by bacterial infection. 
  2. Vaccination can prevent cervical cancers.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: Cervical cancer is one of the leading causes of mortality among women across the world. Most of the cases (90%) is caused by viral infection. The Human Papilloma Virus/ HPV is the causative agent. The cancer develops in the cervix and can spread to other parts of the body. Statement 2 is correct: Vaccination can help prevent cervical cancer. The use of HPV vaccine as a part of routine vaccination is recommended in all countries by WHO. Though the cancer is still prevalent in India (25% of cervical cancer related deaths across the world is in India), the vaccine is yet to be widely implemented.
